A careless engineer used two Blum integers as RSA primes. The encrypted flag is: 3521164244822089629176196020170923570984041899997812961579428910356915559813713888681776342427683812764286992509370698871489658015589195329501666944936842. Can you recover the message by exploiting the weak primes?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7993688234559987596028713634455134380025862845363166393880045967084445350460487770464553868378471383896295817694251885161928898775687001688243654051680289, e=3151028218636163610921162235986625103879199706280473740830467294412754561645851926961995659745898477305753878422381828550148755125487340784697177407771333
The lower 104 bits of p are: 67487822693879495510497584801534341539


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{w7fpxl93}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3521164244822089629176196020170923570984041899997812961579428910356915559813713888681776342427683812764286992509370698871489658015589195329501666944936842
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7993688234559987596028713634455134380025862845363166393880045967084445350460487770464553868378471383896295817694251885161928898775687001688243654051680289, e=3151028218636163610921162235986625103879199706280473740830467294412754561645851926961995659745898477305753878422381828550148755125487340784697177407771333
The lower 104 bits of p are: 67487822693879495510497584801534341539

extra_info: p=74115190486347013399439355191263066815425299608915367377058798226613021340067, q=107854923965047751280191309152223522074527587893341250572837326263971876207467, Ï†(n)=7993688234559987596028713634455134380025862845363166393880045967084445350460305800350102473613791753231952331105361932274426642157737105563753069154132756
